Ye Guardian Angels of this favour'd Isle,</br>Who long with drooping pinions silent stood,</br>While from Britannia's shore to Egypt's Nile</br>Your tears were borne upon the troubled flood—

Strike your harps, nor more complain;</br>Albion bids you raise the strain;</br>Touch the chords with heav'nly fire:</br>Filial love supports the lyre.</br>Hark!  the trembling numbers move,</br>Echoed from the wildest grove!</br>Silver Thames serenely plays,</br>While his Tritons list'ning gaze.
Avaunt, ye crew, whom glaring Faction guides,</br>Nor blast a scene of transport long unknown;</br>Whilst in each royal breast pale grief subsides,</br>Oh!  let soft Nature call the joy her own!

Lo!  expiring Faction lies;</br>England's Genius now shall rise,</br>Peace shall seize his hoary hand,</br>Round him call her smiling band,</br>Form'd of many-colour'd hours,</br>Dazzling shades and winged Pow'rs,</br>Who unseen shall gently sing,</br>O'er a lately woe-worn King.
Ah!  fly his pillow, soul-distracting thought,</br>And thou, dear Mem'ry, paint the past no more;</br>No more hold high the cup by Faction wrought,</br>Whose potion's poison, to each distant shore.

Come blest Concord!  shed thy dews,</br>O'er his mind thy sweets infuse;</br>Lull emotion, sooth his soul,</br>Curb the passions as they roll;</br>Clasp him to thy genial breast,</br>Give him Slumber's lenient rest,</br>And as loathing Discord flies,</br>Bid his softest feelings rise.
'Tis done!  the Furies, fly the blissful scene,</br>Nature alone now keeps her revel high;</br>Here bends a Son; there smiles a virtuous Queen;</br>Bid drops of joy shine in Britannia's eye!

Rouz'd her voice is heard again,</br>Breaking o'er the restless main;</br>Commerce spreads her willing sails,</br>Ceres fills her fav'rite vales,</br>Wisdom aids the warm debate,</br>While the patriot fills her seat.</br>All is rapture, every pow'r</br>Hails with joy the white-wing'd hour.
Approach ye Fathers!  Sons of Virtue haste!</br>And ye fair Daughters of the Village train!</br>Ye Mothers!  who parental bliss wou'd taste,</br>Behold this scene and join my rural strain!

Sing the feelings of the breast,</br>(Long by agony opprest)</br>When it beats to love alone,</br>When that love and duty's one,</br>Ye, who know not rules of art,</br>Shall the poignant joys impart:</br>Then with me resume the song,</br>Echo bears the sound along.
But ah!  what haggard shade is distant seen,</br>Swift approaching o'er yon blasted heath?</br>She nearer comes!  her frown and horrid mien</br>Pronounce her the pale harbinger of Death,

Hence Disease!  fly ghastly form,</br>Nor a nation's fears alarm:</br>Rage not here — ah!  vain the pray'r,</br>O'er the Prince her flames appear;</br>Now they fall!  his bosom burns,</br>Now the shiv'ring pang returns;</br>See his fainting head declines,</br>All relax'd he health resigns.
Oh!  spare him yet!  Thou whose Almighty voice</br>Can charge departing life to turn in haste,</br>Till rushing on, the Spirits all rejoice,</br>When the fair Cherub in the heart is plac'd.

Hark!  the heav'nly fiat sounds,</br>And the boast of Death confounds.</br>"Health to GEORGE" the Seraphs sing;</br>Frighted flies the grisly King;</br>With him fly his horrid train,</br>Burning fever — rending pain.</br>Health returns, the noble youth</br>Led by her to radiant truth,
Exclaims, "Now time retard thy ceaseless course;</br>Slow, yet more slow, pass o'er this happy day;</br>Prolong my rapture, nor abate its force,</br>And bid my filial transports ne'er decay."</br>
